name: Environment Agency LiDAR DTM Hillshade (1m)
description: Bare-earth Digital Terrain Model hillshade from Environment Agency LiDAR composite. Strips away buildings and vegetation to show natural terrain — river valleys of the Irwell, Medlock, and Irk, hills, and the pre-urban landscape beneath modern Manchester.
notes:
Open Government Licence. 1m resolution LiDAR covering ~99% of England.

WMS endpoint (DTM 1m):
https://environment.data.gov.uk/spatialdata/lidar-composite-digital-terrain-model-dtm-1m/wms

Available layers:
  Lidar_Composite_DTM_1m — raw elevation (greyscale)
  Lidar_Composite_Elevation_DTM_1m — colour-ramped elevation
  Lidar_Composite_Hillshade_DTM_1m — hillshade (best for terrain viz)

Also available: DSM (with buildings/trees) at same endpoint pattern.
Supports EPSG:4326, EPSG:3857, EPSG:27700.
